content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #85742 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
this unsoundness seems to be there since almost ever, so perhaps not needing urgent attention, like a P-medium?
This should be an error or a stack overflow, IMO. I'm not so convinced of P-medium.
There should be a very good reason for unsoundness not to be critical IMO

Joshua Nelson said:

There should be a very good reason for unsoundness not to be critical IMO

fair point undoubtedly. I thought if the issue being so old - as the reporter suspects - that could be a mitigating factor

Though now I kind of changed my mind after skimming the related LLVM issue, especially this comment seems to indicate a more recent LLVM patch ("Differential", if I understand LLVM lingo).
So now I'm confused if this is an old or a new thing :-)
@apiraino this was missed when the loop miscompilation was fixed recently. It has always been broken, but the reason it's broken changed in November.
ok I see, thanks! Anyway, that was just me being curious - agree on p-critical regardless
